title: Philemon Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Philemon chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Philemon Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Philemon Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who is the letter of Philemon addressed to according to Philemon 1:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Philemon
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:1 clearly states the letter is addressed to Philemon.

questions.question: Who are mentioned together with Paul as the senders of the letter in Philemon 1:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Timothy
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:1 mentions Paul and Timothy as the senders of the letter.

questions.question: According to Philemon 1:2, to whom besides Philemon is the letter also addressed?
questions.correctAnswer: Apphia and Archippus
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:2 addresses Apphia and Archippus along with the church in Philemon's house.

questions.question: What does Paul wish for Philemon in Philemon 1:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:3 says Paul wishes grace and peace from God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What does Paul continually do for Philemon according to Philemon 1:4?
options: Thanks God and makes mention of him in prayers
questions.correctAnswer: Thanks God and makes mention of him in prayers
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:4 states that Paul always thanks God and mentions Philemon in his prayers.

questions.question: What two qualities of Philemon are praised in Philemon 1:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Love and faith
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:5 praises Philemon's love and faith toward the Lord Jesus and all saints.

questions.question: What is Paul’s relationship to Onesimus as described in Philemon 1:10?
questions.correctAnswer: His son in bonds
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:10 states Paul refers to Onesimus as his son whom he begotten in his bonds.

questions.question: What does Paul say Onesimus was to Philemon in the past according to Philemon 1:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Unprofitable
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:11 mentions Onesimus was previously unprofitable to Philemon.

questions.question: According to Philemon 1:16, how does Paul want Onesimus to be received?
options: Not as a servant but as a beloved brother
questions.correctAnswer: Not as a servant but as a beloved brother
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:16 instructs to receive Onesimus not as a servant but as a beloved brother.

questions.question: What does Paul offer to do if Onesimus owes anything to Philemon, according to Philemon 1:18-19?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul will repay it
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:18-19 shows Paul promises to repay any wrong or debt Onesimus owes.

questions.question: True or False: Paul calls Archippus a fellow soldier in Philemon 1:2.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:2 refers to Archippus as a fellowsoldier.

questions.question: True or False: Paul wrote the letter to Philemon while he was free and traveling.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:1 and 1:9 clearly state Paul was a prisoner of Jesus Christ when writing.

questions.question: True or False: Paul asks Philemon to receive Onesimus only if it is convenient for him, without love.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:14 says Paul wants Philemon to receive Onesimus willingly, not out of necessity.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Philemon 1:3: 'Grace to you, and ______, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: peace
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:3 states 'Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from Philemon 1:20: 'Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my ______ in the Lord.'
questions.correctAnswer: bowels
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:20 says 'refresh my bowels in the Lord.'

medium.title: Philemon Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Philemon Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Philemon 1 teach us about the importance of prayer in a believer's life?
options: Paul gives thanks for Philemon and prays for him always
Prayer is unnecessary when faith is strong
Only church leaders should pray regularly
Prayer is only for asking personal favors
questions.correctAnswer: Paul gives thanks for Philemon and prays for him always
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:4 shows Paul thanking God and always mentioning Philemon in his prayers, illustrating the importance of persistent prayer and intercession. This is supported by v5 (faith and love) and v6 (effectual communication of faith through prayer).

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to forgive someone who wronged them. Based on Philemon 1, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Forgiveness involves receiving the offender as a beloved brother, not as a servant
You should ignore wrongdoing and never address it
Only wait to forgive if the person apologizes first
questions.correctAnswer: Forgiveness involves receiving the offender as a beloved brother, not as a servant
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:16 encourages receiving Onesimus not as a servant but as a beloved brother, showing that forgiveness and reconciliation restore relationships and elevate status in Christ. This is tied to love (v7) and partnership (v17).

questions.question: What example does Paul set for humility and gentle persuasion in his letter to Philemon?
options: Paul appeals out of love and not command, though he has boldness in Christ
Paul uses harsh language to assert authority
questions.correctAnswer: Paul appeals out of love and not command, though he has boldness in Christ
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:8-9 shows Paul choosing to appeal lovingly rather than command, demonstrating humility and gentleness. This teaches believers to act out of love and respect rather than forceful authority (v14).

questions.question: How does the relationship between Paul and Onesimus illustrate spiritual parenthood and discipleship?
options: Paul calls Onesimus his son, indicating spiritual fatherhood
Paul treats Onesimus as a distant acquaintance
Onesimus is only a servant with no spiritual relationship
Paul rejects Onesimus because of past faults
questions.correctAnswer: Paul calls Onesimus his son, indicating spiritual fatherhood
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:10 identifies Onesimus as Paul's son in his bonds, showing the role of a spiritual father in nurturing and discipling others. This is linked to responsibility and care in Christian relationships (v11-13).

questions.question: What does Philemon 1 teach about integrity and accountability in relationships?
options: Paul offers to repay any wrong Onesimus has done to Philemon
Wrongdoing should be ignored to keep peace
Philemon should seek revenge for any harm
Onesimus is left to settle debts on his own
questions.correctAnswer: Paul offers to repay any wrong Onesimus has done to Philemon
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:18-19 reveals Paul taking responsibility for any wrong or debt Onesimus owes, exemplifying integrity and accountability among believers. This encourages honesty and stewardship in relationships.

questions.question: True or False: Paul requests Philemon to prepare lodging for him, showing trust in fellowship and hospitality.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:22 shows Paul asking Philemon to prepare lodging, indicating trust in the fellowship and hospitality within the Christian community, which strengthens bonds and supports ministry.

questions.question: How does Philemon 1 encourage believers to express love and refresh the hearts of fellow saints?
options: By acts of kindness that refresh the souls of brothers and sisters
By ignoring the needs of others to focus on self
By only attending church services without personal involvement
By judging others to enforce discipline
questions.correctAnswer: By acts of kindness that refresh the souls of brothers and sisters
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:7 mentions the joy and consolation in Philemon's love because the hearts of the saints are refreshed by him, teaching believers to serve and encourage others practically and lovingly.

questions.question: Who are the individuals Paul mentions as fellow laborers or companions in the letter, highlighting the importance of teamwork in ministry?
questions.correctAnswer: Epaphras, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:23-24 lists these men as Paul's fellow workers, emphasizing the collaborative nature of ministry and fellowship in the early church.

questions.question: According to Philemon 1, what role does faith play in the effective communication of good things in Christ?
options: Faith makes communication effectual by acknowledging good in believers
Faith is irrelevant to how we communicate
Faith should be hidden and not shared
Faith only benefits the individual, not others
questions.correctAnswer: Faith makes communication effectual by acknowledging good in believers
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:6 teaches that the communication of faith becomes effective by recognizing every good thing in Christ within believers, showing the role of faith in edifying the church.

questions.question: True or False: Paul insists Onesimus must stay with him and does not consider Philemon's wishes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:14 clearly states Paul would do nothing without Philemon's consent, highlighting respect for others' will and voluntary service in Christian relationships.

questions.question: Which spiritual virtue is demonstrated by Paul’s confidence in Philemon's obedience and willingness to do more than asked?
questions.correctAnswer: Trust and encouragement
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:21 shows Paul’s confidence in Philemon’s obedience and his expectation that he will surpass what is asked, teaching the value of trusting and encouraging fellow believers.

questions.question: What does Paul’s description of Archippus as a fellowsoldier teach about Christian service?
options: Christian service is like a spiritual battle requiring perseverance
Service is only for pastors and elders
Believers should avoid struggle in ministry
Only military personnel can serve God
questions.correctAnswer: Christian service is like a spiritual battle requiring perseverance
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:2 calls Archippus a fellowsoldier, illustrating that serving Christ involves spiritual struggle and perseverance, encouraging believers to remain steadfast.

questions.question: How does Paul model generosity and stewardship in his letter to Philemon?
options: By offering to repay any debt Onesimus owes Philemon himself
By asking Philemon to pay for Paul's expenses
questions.correctAnswer: By offering to repay any debt Onesimus owes Philemon himself
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:18-19 shows Paul taking financial responsibility for Onesimus’ debts, exemplifying generosity and faithful stewardship in relationships.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Paul greets Philemon, Apphia, Archippus, and the church in your ______.
questions.correctAnswer: house
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:2 explicitly mentions the church in Philemon's house, highlighting the practice of house churches in early Christianity.

questions.question: What does Paul mean by calling Onesimus "profitable" now to Philemon and to himself?
options: Onesimus has become useful and beneficial through faith
Onesimus is only valuable as a servant
questions.correctAnswer: Onesimus has become useful and beneficial through faith
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:11 contrasts Onesimus' past unprofitability with his current usefulness, symbolizing transformation through faith and service in Christ.

hard.title: Philemon Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Philemon Chapter 1.

questions.question: Who is addressed as a 'fellowlabourer' alongside Philemon in the opening greeting?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul
questions.explanation: In Philemon 1:1, Paul refers to Philemon as a 'fellowlabourer', indicating a partnership in ministry.

questions.question: Which individuals are greeted along with Philemon in the letter, illustrating early Christian household churches?
options: Apphia, Archippus, and the church in thy house
questions.correctAnswer: Apphia, Archippus, and the church in thy house
questions.explanation: Philemon 1:2 mentions Apphia, Archippus, and the church that meets in Philemon's house, showing the cultural practice of home churches.

questions.question: The phrase 'Grace to you, and peace' in Philemon 1:3 echoes greetings found in which other Pauline epistles?
questions.correctAnswer: Romans, Corinthians, and Galatians
questions.explanation: The greeting 'Grace and peace' is common in Pauline letters such as Romans, Corinthians, and Galatians, reflecting Jewish and early Christian liturgical traditions.

questions.question: What is the significance of Paul's reference to Onesimus as 'my son' in Philemon 1:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual sonship through ministry
questions.explanation: Paul calls Onesimus 'my son' indicating a spiritual relationship formed during imprisonment, reflecting the concept of spiritual parenthood in ministry.

questions.question: Paul describes Onesimus as formerly 'unprofitable' but now 'profitable'. What Greek word underlies 'profitable' and what is its significance?
questions.correctAnswer: 'Chrēsimos' meaning useful or beneficial
questions.explanation: The Greek term 'chrēsimos' used here indicates usefulness or benefit, highlighting Onesimus's transformation from uselessness to value (Philemon 1:11).

questions.question: What literary device is present in Paul's plea to Philemon, balancing between 'boldness' and 'love' in Philemon 1:8-9?
questions.correctAnswer: Antithesis
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts boldness in Christ with a gentle appeal for love’s sake, using antithesis to emphasize persuasion over command.

questions.question: In Philemon 1:14, Paul states he would do nothing without Philemon's mind. What does this reveal about early Christian ethics?
questions.correctAnswer: Voluntary obedience rather than compulsion
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes willing consent over coercion, reflecting early Christian values of love and freedom in obedience.

questions.question: How does Paul’s instruction to receive Onesimus 'not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved' (Philemon 1:16) relate to the broader biblical theme of reconciliation?
options: It echoes the new identity in Christ as family
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes the new identity in Christ as family
questions.explanation: Paul redefines social status through Christian brotherhood, aligning with themes of reconciliation and unity seen in other epistles.

questions.question: Paul offers to repay any wrong Onesimus has done to Philemon. How does this prefigure New Testament teachings on atonement and substitution?
options: Paul acts as a substitute, foreshadowing Christ's atonement
questions.correctAnswer: Paul acts as a substitute, foreshadowing Christ's atonement
questions.explanation: Paul’s personal offer to repay reflects the substitutionary role Christ fulfills for sinners, a central New Testament theme.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the term 'bowels' as used in Philemon 1:7 and 1:20, and how does it reflect ancient Near Eastern idioms?
questions.correctAnswer: Inner affections or compassion
questions.explanation: In ancient Hebrew and Greek, 'bowels' symbolized deep emotions or compassion, revealing the heartfelt nature of Christian love.

questions.question: The mention of fellow prisoners and labourers such as Epaphras, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Lucas (Philemon 1:23-24) indicates what about early Christian ministry?
options: It was a communal and collaborative effort
questions.correctAnswer: It was a communal and collaborative effort
questions.explanation: Paul’s greetings show a network of co-workers, highlighting early Christian ministry’s interconnected nature.

questions.question: True or False: Paul writes this letter from a position of freedom and authority, commanding Philemon to comply.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as a prisoner and appeals out of love and persuasion, not by command (Philemon 1:9).

questions.question: Paul’s confidence that Philemon will do even more than he asks (Philemon 1:21) reflects what aspect of their relationship?
questions.correctAnswer: Trust and spiritual partnership
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confident expectation based on their shared faith and partnership in the gospel.

questions.question: The closing benediction 'The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit' (Philemon 1:25) is an example of what common Pauline theological motif?
options: Invocation of grace as sustaining power
questions.correctAnswer: Invocation of grace as sustaining power
questions.explanation: Paul frequently ends letters with a wish for divine grace to empower and sustain believers, emphasizing its centrality.

questions.question: In the cultural context of the ancient Near East, what does Paul's request to 'prepare me also a lodging' (Philemon 1:22) reveal about early Christian hospitality practices?
options: It reflects the importance of hospitality as ministry support
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the importance of hospitality as ministry support
questions.explanation: Hospitality was vital for itinerant preachers, and Paul’s request shows reliance on local believers for support.

theological.title: Philemon Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Philemon Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who is identified as 'a prisoner of Jesus Christ' in the opening greeting of Philemon?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul
questions.explanation: Paul describes himself as 'a prisoner of Jesus Christ' in the greeting (Philemon 1:1). This highlights his suffering for the gospel, consistent with other Pauline epistles (Acts 28:16; 2 Timothy 1:8; Hebrews 10:34; Philippians 1:13).

questions.question: To whom, besides Philemon, is the letter addressed?
options: Apphia, Archippus, and the church in his house
Timothy, Luke, and the church in Colosse
Onesimus, Marcus, and the church in Ephesus
questions.correctAnswer: Apphia, Archippus, and the church in his house
questions.explanation: Paul addresses the letter to Philemon, Apphia, Archippus, and the church in Philemon's house (Philemon 1:2). This reflects the early Christian practice of house churches (Romans 16:5; 1 Corinthians 16:19; Colossians 4:15; Acts 16:15).

questions.question: What blessing does Paul invoke upon Philemon and the recipients at the beginning of the letter?
options: Grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
Joy and hope from the Holy Spirit
Wisdom and strength from the Lord
Faith and love from the Father and Son
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Paul opens with a benediction of 'grace and peace' from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ (Philemon 1:3), a common Pauline greeting emphasizing divine favor and spiritual well-being (Romans 1:7; 1 Corinthians 1:3; 2 Corinthians 1:2; Ephesians 1:2).

questions.question: What reasons does Paul give for thanking God when he prays for Philemon?
options: For Philemon's love and faith toward the Lord Jesus and all saints
For Philemon's zeal and missionary work
questions.correctAnswer: For Philemon's love and faith toward the Lord Jesus and all saints
questions.explanation: Paul thanks God always mentioning Philemon in his prayers because of his love and faith toward Jesus and all the saints (Philemon 1:4-5). This reflects the biblical emphasis on faith and love as marks of true discipleship (Galatians 5:6; 1 Corinthians 13:13; Hebrews 10:22-24; 1 John 3:16-18).

questions.question: What is the purpose Paul expresses for the communication of Philemon's faith?
options: That it may become effective by acknowledging every good thing in Christ Jesus
That it may grow stronger through trials and suffering
That it may convert many Gentiles to the faith
That it may be preserved without error
questions.correctAnswer: That it may become effective by acknowledging every good thing in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Paul prays that the fellowship of Philemon's faith may become effective through acknowledging every good thing in Christ (Philemon 1:6). This emphasizes the transformative power of faith expressed in knowledge and recognition of Christ’s work (Colossians 1:10; Ephesians 3:17-19; Hebrews 10:22; James 2:22).

questions.question: How does Paul describe the effect of Philemon's love on the saints?
options: It refreshes the bowels of the saints
questions.correctAnswer: It refreshes the bowels of the saints
questions.explanation: Paul states that the saints are refreshed by Philemon’s love (Philemon 1:7). The term 'bowels' figuratively refers to deep affections or compassion, showing how Christian love nourishes and comforts the community (Romans 12:15; 2 Corinthians 7:13; Philippians 2:1; Colossians 3:12).

questions.question: What approach does Paul take in appealing to Philemon regarding Onesimus?
options: He appeals with love rather than command
He commands Philemon to obey immediately
He threatens to withdraw support if disobedient
He remains silent and lets others persuade
questions.correctAnswer: He appeals with love rather than command
questions.explanation: Paul chooses to appeal to Philemon out of love rather than using his authority to command (Philemon 1:8-9). This demonstrates the biblical principle of persuasion through love and gentleness (2 Corinthians 10:1; Galatians 6:1; Ephesians 4:2; Colossians 3:12).

questions.question: Who is Onesimus, according to Paul’s description?
options: Paul’s son whom he begotten in his bonds
A fellow laborer in the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Paul’s son whom he begotten in his bonds
questions.explanation: Paul calls Onesimus 'my son, whom I have begotten in my bonds' (Philemon 1:10), indicating Onesimus became a spiritual child through Paul’s ministry during imprisonment (1 Corinthians 4:14; 1 Timothy 1:2; 1 Thessalonians 2:11; 2 Timothy 1:2).

questions.question: How does Paul describe Onesimus’s usefulness now compared to before?
options: Previously unprofitable, now profitable to both Philemon and Paul
Only profitable to Paul, not to Philemon
questions.correctAnswer: Previously unprofitable, now profitable to both Philemon and Paul
questions.explanation: Paul notes that Onesimus was once unprofitable but now is profitable to Paul and Philemon (Philemon 1:11). This reflects the transformative power of salvation and reconciliation (Luke 15:11-32; 2 Corinthians 5:17; Ezekiel 36:26; Matthew 21:28-31).

questions.question: What does Paul urge Philemon to do with Onesimus upon his return?
options: Receive him as a beloved brother, not just a servant
Send him away to another church
questions.correctAnswer: Receive him as a beloved brother, not just a servant
questions.explanation: Paul asks Philemon to receive Onesimus not as a servant but as a beloved brother in both flesh and the Lord (Philemon 1:16). This illustrates the Christian doctrine of reconciliation and equality in Christ (Galatians 3:28; Colossians 3:11; Ephesians 2:14-16; Matthew 23:8).

questions.question: What does Paul offer to do if Onesimus has wronged Philemon or owes him anything?
options: The church will collect the debt
questions.correctAnswer: Paul will repay it himself
questions.explanation: Paul offers to repay any wrong or debt Onesimus owes to Philemon (Philemon 1:18-19). This reflects Christ’s substitutionary atonement, where He pays the debt of sinners (Isaiah 53:4-6; 2 Corinthians 5:21; Romans 5:8; Hebrews 9:28).

questions.question: What is Paul's attitude toward Philemon’s obedience in handling the situation with Onesimus?
options: Confident that Philemon will do even more than Paul asks
questions.correctAnswer: Confident that Philemon will do even more than Paul asks
questions.explanation: Paul expresses confidence in Philemon’s obedience and expects him to do more than what Paul has requested (Philemon 1:21). This shows Paul’s trust in the work of the Holy Spirit in believers (Philippians 2:13; Romans 8:14; 2 Corinthians 9:8; Hebrews 13:21).

questions.question: Which fellow laborers does Paul mention as sending greetings in this letter?
options: Epaphras, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Lucas
Timothy, Silas, Barnabas, Mark, and Luke
questions.correctAnswer: Epaphras, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Lucas
questions.explanation: Paul greets Epaphras, Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, and Lucas as his fellow laborers (Philemon 1:23-24). These individuals also appear in other Pauline letters, indicating the interconnectedness of early Christian ministry (Colossians 4:10-14; Acts 19:29; 2 Timothy 4:10; Luke 1:3).

questions.question: What final blessing does Paul pronounce on the recipients of the letter?
options: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit
Peace be with you and all who love our Lord Jesus
May the Holy Spirit guide you in all truth
Joy and hope in believing abound to you
questions.correctAnswer: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit
questions.explanation: Paul concludes with a benediction invoking 'the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ' to be with their spirit (Philemon 1:25). This blessing underscores the sufficiency of divine grace for Christian life (2 Corinthians 12:9; Romans 16:20; Jude 1:2; Ephesians 2:8).

questions.question: What does Paul's request concerning Onesimus teach about Christian forgiveness and reconciliation?
options: That forgiveness should be extended as a willing act of love, not compulsion
That reconciliation should only occur after restitution
That forgiveness is unnecessary if the offender repays debts
questions.correctAnswer: That forgiveness should be extended as a willing act of love, not compulsion
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly states he would do nothing without Philemon's consent so that forgiveness and reception of Onesimus would be voluntary, not forced (Philemon 1:14). This aligns with biblical teachings on forgiveness as an act of grace and love (Matthew 18:21-22; Luke 6:37; Ephesians 4:32; Colossians 3:13).
